sen.j: 姪娘（めいのいらつめ、生没年不詳）は、蘇我倉山田石川麻呂の娘。
sen.e: Mei no iratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro.
Mei no iratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro.
Mei no iratsume (year of birth and death unknown) was a daughter of SOGANOKURA-YAMADA no Ishikawamaro.

sen.j: 天智天皇の妃となり、御名部皇女と阿陪皇女（後の元明天皇）を生む。
sen.e: She married Emperor Tenji (Emperor Tenchi) and bore Minabe no Himemiko (Princess Minabe) and Ahe no Himemiko (Princess Ahe who became Empress Genmei).
She became a wife of Emperor Tenji (Emperor Tenchi) and gave birth to Minabe no Himemiko (Princess Minabe) and Ahe no Himemiko (Princess Ahe who became Empress Genmei).
sen.cmt: 「の妃となり」をbecame a wife ofに、「を生む」をgave birth toに変更しました。
sen.e: She became a wife of Emperor Tenji (Emperor Tenchi) and gave birth to Minabe no Himemiko (Princess Minabe) and Ahe no Himemiko (Princess Ahe who became Empress Genmei).

sen.j: 姉には、同じく天智天皇の妃となった遠智娘がいる。
sen.e: Ochi no iratume, who married Emperor Tenji as well, was her older sister.
Ochi no iratume, who also became a wife of Emperor Tenji, was her older sister.
sen.cmt: 「同じく～の妃となり」をalso became a wife ofに変更しました。
sen.e: Ochi no iratume, who also became a wife of Emperor Tenji, was her older sister.

sen.j: 同じ天智天皇の妃となった、蘇我赤兄の娘常陸娘・天武天皇に嫁いだ大蕤娘姉妹とは従姉妹にあたる。
sen.e: Among her cousins, Hitachi no iratsume, a daughter of SOGA no Akae, married Emperor Tenji as well, and Onu no iratsume married Emperor Tenmu.
sen.cmt: 常陸娘Hitachi no iratsume大蕤娘Onu no iratsume
sen.e: Hitachi no iratsume, who was a daughter of SOGA no Akae and also became a wife of Emperor Tenji, and Onu no iratsume, who married Emperor Tenmu, were her cousins.
sen.cmt: 常陸娘と大蕤娘を主語にして言い換えました。
sen.e: Hitachi no iratsume, who was a daughter of SOGA no Akae and also became a wife of Emperor Tenji, and Onu no iratsume, who married Emperor Tenmu, were her cousins.

sen.j: 姉の死後は、自身の2人の娘とともに、姉の遺した2人の皇女も一緒に育てたといわれる。
sen.e: It has been said that after her sister had died, she raised her sister's two daughters as well as her own daughters.
It is said that she raised two imperial princesses left after her sister's death as well as her own two daughters.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れを補足して、現在形に変更しました。
sen.e: It is said that she raised two imperial princesses left after her sister's death as well as her own two daughters.

sen.j: そのため、姉の子どもである鸕野讃良皇女（持統天皇）は、のちに、我が子草壁の妃に姪娘の娘の阿陪皇女（元明天皇）を、草壁の死後、片腕となった高市皇子の妃に御名部皇女を迎えた。
sen.e: One of Ochi no iratsume's daughters, Uno no Sarara no Himemiko (Princess Uno no Sarara) became Empress Jito; presumably, the Empress felt an obligation to Mei no iratsume for the kindness and decided the marriage between her son Kusakabe no Miko (Prince Kusakabe) and Mei no iratsume's daughter Ahe no Himemiko; besides, after Kusakabe no Miko had died, she decided the marriage between her right arm Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Mei no iratsume's other daughter Minabe no Himemiko.

For this reason, Princess Uno no Sarara (later, Empress Jito), one of her sister's daughters, took one of Mei no iratsume's daughters Princess Ahe (Empress Genmei) to a wife of her son Prince Kusakabe, and took the other daughter Minabe no Himemiko to a wife of her right arm Prince Takechi after Kusakabe's death.
